article.headline: Northwestern St. 81, McNeese St. 71
article.story: NATCHITOCHES, La. (AP) -- Trey Gilder's 15 points led five double-figure scorers for Northwestern State as the Demons won for the fifth time in six games, handily defeating McNeese State 81-71 on Thursday night. C.J. Clark added 13 points for Northwestern State (12-14, 8-4 Southland Conference), while Colby Bargeman had 11 and Keithan Hancock and Jerry Moody added 10 apiece as the Demons shot 46 percent from the field and a blistering 85 percent (23-27) on free throws. The Demons never trailed, going up by 10 points for the first time with 6:32 left in the first half and leading 43-31 at halftime. McNeese (10-13, 4-7) trailed by as many as 17 points midway through the final period and never got closer than the final margin. The Cowboys, who beat the Demons 85-74 on Jan. 23, picked up 15 points from John Ford, 12 each by Jarvis Bradley and John Pinchon, and 10 from Stephan Martin.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
